p: Based on the above discussion we suggest that the δ 18O in the stalagmite from Mavri Trypa Cave should be interpreted as a signal for moisture, although there may be an influence of kinetic fractionation, with more negative δ 18O values indicating wetter conditions and vice versa. The δ 13C signal from Mavri Trypa may tentatively be used as a proxy for biological activity above the cave linked to moisture availability. However, in this paper we favor the use of δ 18O over δ 13C for making interpretations about past hydro-climatic variability, although we use the δ 13C signal to better understand the δ 18O.
